scenarioDescription:
The MOA-2010-BLG-328L Exoplanetary System


Overview

MOA-2010-BLG-328L is a star with 0.11 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 2641.86 light years away from the solar system.

MOA-2010-BLG-328L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the MOA-2010-BLG-328L system


MOA-2010-BLG-328L b

MOA-2010-BLG-328L b was discovered by the MOA observatory, in 2013-12, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.92 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of MOA-2010-BLG-328L b is 9.222 times the mass of Earth. The radius of MOA-2010-BLG-328L b is 2.990 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, MOA-2010-BLG-328L b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system MOA-2010-BLG-328L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the MOA.
name: MOA-2010-BLG-328L - System With 1 Exoplanet
